sen.j: 難太平記（なんたいへいき）は今川貞世（出家後は今川了俊）が応永9年（1402年）に完成させた書物である。
sen.e: Nan-Taiheiki is a book which was completed by Sadayo IMAGAWA (after becoming a priest, known as Ryoshun IMAGAWA) in 1402.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nan-Taiheiki is a book which was completed by Sadayo IMAGAWA (after becoming a priest, known as Ryoshun IMAGAWA) in 1402.
Nan-Taiheiki is a book which was completed by Sadayo IMAGAWA (after becoming a priest, known as Ryoshun IMAGAWA) in 1402.

sen.j: 今川氏の歴史と足利氏の歴史などが主要な内容で、子孫に宛てて書かれている。
sen.e: It mainly deals with the histories of the Imagawa and Ashikaga clans, and was written to his descendants.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It mainly deals with the histories of the Imagawa and Ashikaga clans, and was written to his descendants.
It mainly deals with the histories of the Imagawa and Ashikaga clans, and was written to his descendants.

sen.j: 書名は後世につけられたと考えられており、著述時点では名称はなかったと考えられる。
sen.e: The title of this book seems to have been named by posterity and not to have had a name when it was completed.
The title of this book seems to have been named by posterity and not to have had a name when it was completed.
The title of this book seems to have been named by posterity and not to have had a name when it was completed.

sen.j: 書名の由来は、この書物の前半部分が『太平記』が今川家を軽んじていると難じている（批判している）ことにある。
sen.e: The first half of this book criticizes that "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace) thought little of the Imagawa family, from which the title of the book came.
The first half of this book criticizes that "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace) thought little of the Imagawa family, from which the title of the book came.
The first half of this book criticizes that "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace) thought little of the Imagawa family, from which the title of the book came.

sen.j: 後半は、貞世が実地に経験した南北朝時代 (日本)の後半から室町時代の初期の出来事が記されている。
sen.e: The latter half is about the incidents which Sadayo actually experienced from the late Northern and Southern Dynasties (Japan) to the early Muromachi period.
The latter half is about the incidents which Sadayo actually experienced from the late Northern and Southern Dynasties (Japan) to the early Muromachi period.
The latter half is about the incidents which Sadayo actually experienced from the late Northern and Southern Dynasties (Japan) to the early Muromachi period.

sen.j: 内容は、下記のとおり。
sen.e: The contents is as follows.
The contents are as follows.
